generaltextareastub_06yp8.value: Ever since, we’ve been asked two questions. Why now? And what makes us think we can do it?

generaltextareastub_0bwdh.value: Our answer here is also simple - We know the task is great. But the technology exists.

generaltextareastub_3dfb8.value: We invite you to imagine this future, and if you find it as inspiring as we do, we hope you’ll join us.

generaltextareastub_478yj.value: Our answer to the first question is as simple as it is stark.

generaltextareastub_556pq.value: Which brings us to the second question - What makes us think we can execute this bold mission?

generaltextareastub_8kb2r.value:
One development that unlocked this change was the tremendous drop in the price of electricity from solar and wind—over 90% in the last decade.

At Prometheus, we’ve developed a unique tech stack that combines integrated direct air capture of CO2, cutting edge catalysts for conversion of CO2 to fuels, and a novel membrane that eliminates the need for distillation. All of the tech in Prometheus’s CO2-to-fuels process is powered only by renewable electricity, which is why we call our zero net carbon fuel “electric fuel.”

The only inputs to our process are air and renewable power. The only outputs are fuel and oxygen. There are no agricultural inputs and no waste products. And there is no limit to the scale at which CO2 can be converted into fuels. It is possible to completely replace the global use of fossil oil and gas with our zero net carbon fuels. By doing this, we can lower annual CO2 emissions by more than 20 gigatons per year, half of all emissions today. By using CO2 to make carbon negative objects—or as we call them, “banked-carbon goods”—we can remove historical CO2 emissions, storing them in useful products forever. This is how we can solve the climate crisis.

generaltextareastub_ety6f.value: We know we have to move fast, maybe scaling faster than any industry has moved before. But we believe it’s possible and we have a plan to do it.

generaltextareastub_gbul0.value: Prometheus was founded to achieve an audacious goal - to replace all oil and gas with zero net carbon fuels made from CO2 in the air.

generaltextareastub_gmsa6.value: The climate crisis is the greatest threat humankind has ever faced. No less than the fate of the planet and all the life it supports hang in the balance. The stakes could not be higher.

generaltextareastub_j5hdd.value:
The pivotal moment that created Prometheus came in October of 2018 after two landmark events. The first was when the United Nations’ scientific panel on climate change released a dire report. In a list of scenes, it laid out, in graphic detail, the staggering destruction the world was all but certain to suffer in just a few short years. There was still time, the report said, to stop climate change and avoid the worst impacts. But only if the world took immediate, radical steps, not just to curb new emissions, but to remove CO2 from the air.

Heeding this call, two weeks later, Y Combinator, the acclaimed Silicon Valley accelerator, put out a request: any founder with an idea for how to remove that CO2 from the air should step forward. “It’s time to take big swings at this,” it said.

We knew we had to act. That winter, Prometheus was accepted to Y Combinator and launched on Demo Day the following March. Before a packed auditorium, Prometheus founder and CEO, Rob McGinnis explained how the company could pull CO2 from the air and turn it into jet fuel, diesel, and gasoline that were atomically identical to their fossil counterparts. Not only would Prometheus’s fuels be 100% carbon neutral, their production could be scaled in time to save the Earth.

generaltextareastub_nusco.value: Engineers have known how to make synthetic fuel from the air for nearly a century, but only recently has it been possible to make zero net carbon synthetic fuel at a price that can compete with fossil fuels.

generaltextareastub_rc7nd.value:
Given the magnitude of the crisis, there are some who think that the only way to respond is to fundamentally change who we are. To do and be less.

We, at Prometheus, think this would be a terrible mistake. We believe we can meet this epic challenge not in spite of, but because of who we are.

The urge to discover what lies beyond that far horizon, or that ocean, or this planet, is part of what makes us human. We are explorers and adventurers. We search for inspiration, for what’s new and what’s next. And we yearn to live better, larger lives. Throughout human existence, this restless impulse has led our species to overcome near unfathomable hardships. And it’s exactly this ability that we need now.

We shouldn’t shrink the scope of human experience. Instead, our goal should be to break the historical link between energy and the dirty fossil fuels that are destroying our world. Instead, we should make energy and the things we do with it in a brand new way.

This is our mission at Prometheus. We are propelled by the future we imagine—one in which everyone who wants to can experience the joy of a road trip, the thrill of flight, and, one day soon, the humbling awe of viewing the Earth from orbit.

generaltextareastub_tax31.value: We also know that in order to succeed, our fuels can’t just be as good as fossil fuels, they have to be better. That’s why we’ve designed them to be high-performance and clean-burning. Most importantly, our fuels will cost the same or less than fossil fuels.

chapterstorystub.copy:
Since the beginning,
we've been driven
to explore

Called by the
open road, and the
spirit of adventure

To seek the thrill
of heading into
the unknown

But to go where we want
to go next, we need a
new kind of fuel

But what if we could
remove this CO2?
chapterstorystub.extra1:
For centuries, the way we've
made fuel has choked the
air with CO2, dangerously
warming the planet

chapterstorystub.copy:
And turn it into
zero net carbon fuels
chapterstorystub.extra1:
That cost the same as
fuels extracted from
the ground

chapterstorystub.copy:
Let's dive into
a titan fuel forge
Stage 1A
chapterstorystub.extra1:
Strong fans draw air
into our carbon
salvage tower

chapterstorystub.copy: Stage 1B
chapterstorystub.extra1:
As the air whips past,
a powerful waterfall
strips it of CO2 and
water molecules

As they stream into the forge,
the molecules are "energized"
by renewable power to form
hydrocarbons that can be made
into any type of fuel

chapterstorystub.copy: Stage 3
chapterstorystub.extra1:
Because we're turning electrical
energy from solar and wind into
the chemical energy of fuels,
you can think of our fuels as
"liquid electricity."

We call them "electrofuels."

chapterstorystub.copy: Cleaner Air
chapterstorystub.extra1:
The only byproduct of our
process is oxygen. It actually
cleans the air around it

chapterstorystub.copy: The Result
chapterstorystub.extra1:
The result is zero net carbon
gasoline, diesel, and jet fuel
that are atomically identical
to fossil fuels, cost the same,
and can run in any engine

chapterstorystub.copy: A New Era
chapterstorystub.extra1:
The moment you fill
your tank, you drive
into a whole new era
chapterstorystub.extra2:
the era of Net
Zero Emissions

chapterstorystub.copy:
As you pull away,
the surge of
freedom is classic
chapterstorystub.extra1:
But this is no ordinary
road trip. You’re running
on fuel that doesn’t
harm the planet

chapterstorystub.copy:
You pass big rigs, which
haul 70% of U.S. freight.
They’re powered by
zero net carbon diesel

Overhead, a jet soars.
Its cross-country flight
is 100% carbon neutral

The old, polluting 20th
century technology is
where it belongs

At Prometheus,
we make energy in
a brand new way
— from the air
chapterstorystub.extra1:
Using renewable power,
we can turn atmospheric CO2
into all kinds of things

chapterstorystub.copy:
From zero net
carbon spirits,
like gin and whiskey

To carbon negative
goods that store
their CO2 forever

The goal is a world
of limitless potential,
where both humans
and the planet can thrive

Net Zero may be our
nearest destination,
but the journey is
just beginning

chapterstorystub.extra1: Learn more about how we make our products

chapterstorystub.copy:
So we have the tech to
turn CO₂ from the air
into zero net carbon fuel
chapterstorystub.extra1:
How do we get it into our
cars, trucks, planes, and ships
in time to save the planet?

chapterstorystub.copy: We build a MetaForge

The MetaForge is the
factory that will mass produce
our Titan Fuel Forges
chapterstorystub.extra1:
We call it a MetaForge
because it's a big forge
that makes forges

chapterstorystub.copy:
Our fuel forges will be
installed far and wide,
anywhere there's
renewable power

Our fuel forges will be
installed far and wide,
anywhere renewable
power can be made

One MetaForge can make
500,000 forges each year

Each fuel forge can
make approx. 20,000 gallons
of zero net carbon
fuel per year

That means, every year,
a single forge can turn
35 gas-powered cars
into zero carbon cars
chapterstorystub.extra2:
Let's do the math -
if the MetaForge
makes 500,000
forges in a year
chapterstorystub.extra5:
another 17.8 million
cars become zero
carbon vehicles

chapterstorystub.copy:
At this rate, one MetaForge
can decarbonize over 10%
of the world's gas-powered
cars in less than a decade
chapterstorystub.extra1:
But we want to
get them all
chapterstorystub.extra2: so we'll build as many MetaForges as it takes
chapterstorystub.extra3:
This is how we
power the 21st century

chapterstorystub.extra1:
Learn about the MetaForge
and the story behind this chapter

contact.disclaimer: We are collecting this information so that we can contact you in the future with updates about our product. We will never share it with any third party companies and you may unsubscribe at any time by following the instructions in the emails you receive.
contact.formHeader: STAY UP TO DATE WITH OUR PROGRESS AND HOW YOU CAN SUPPORT US

contact.title: JOIN THE ENERGY REVOLUTION

generaltextareastub_6xdcr.value: We turn CO2 from the air into gasoline, diesel & jet fuel

generaltextstub_0in0m.description: home page CTA - link to About/Mission page

generaltextareastub.value: In Stage One, CO2 and water are captured from the air. Industrial fans suck air in and blow it across a waterfall that absorbs CO2 and water.

In Stage Two, the captured CO2 and water combine with renewable electricity in a hydrocarbon electrolyzer called the Faraday Reactor. The electricity 'charges' or 'energizes' the carbon with hydrogen molecules from the water to make fuel.
During this step, our Forge releases oxygen - its only byproduct - functioning as a 'mechanical forest.'
In Stage Four, a final catalyst step combines the fuel molecules into longer-chain hydrocarbons and recovers water. This step can be customized to make gasoline, diesel, or jet fuel.

In Stage Three, the fuels are separated from water using a new membrane called the Maxwell Core. Its carbon nanotube pores allow fuels through while rejecting water. The Maxwell Core makes distillation obsolete.

generaltextareastub.description: This is the bolded first paragraph text
generaltextareastub.value: The Prometheus Titan Fuel Forge is a reverse combustion machine. It pulls CO2 and water [a.k.a. exhaust] from the air and combines them with electricity from solar and wind power to make low-cost, high-performance, zero net carbon e-fuels.
These fuels are 'engine-ready,' able to run in our existing cars, trucks, and planes with no modification.
